discussion.author: erikmd
discussion.comment:
BTW the GitLab CI report is not yet available since the steps mentioned in [https://github.com/coq/bot#…](https://github.com/coq/bot#rely-on-coqbot-to-synchronize-your-github-prs-with-your-gitlab-project) have to be performed beforehand.
FYI I was just able to do the required steps on the GitLab CI side (adding @coqbot as Developer and add two webhooks in GitLab CI).
Could one owner of https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp do the other steps required on the GitHub side?

> * go to "Settings" / "Collaborators & teams" to add @coqbot as a collaborator (so that it can push status checks).
> * go to "Settings" / "Webhooks" and add one webhook with URL https://coqbot.herokuapp.com/pull_request that will only be triggered by pull request events. Make sure you change the "content/type" value to "application/json".
 
Finally, you could also disable Travis CI builds…
Cc @CohenCyril @gares

discussion.author: erikmd
discussion.comment: GitLab CI is now enabled and I believe it would suffice to close and reopen this PR to (re)trigger the build.

discussion.author: gares
discussion.comment: After a discussion with @ggonthier I'm refining the semantics of `{x..}y` so that these failures don't occur. Hence I'm closing this PR.
